body:
~~Reproduced on the Flatpak running on Ubuntu 22.04~~

Edit: My stack is different, and is fixed in newer versions of GNOME.
```
Thread 1 "obs" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007fffbc05e68d in obs_pipewire_connect_stream () from /app//lib/obs-plugins/linux-pipewire.so
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007fffbc05e68d in obs_pipewire_connect_stream () at /app//lib/obs-plugins/linux-pipewire.so
#1  0x00007fffbc05fefa in  () at /app//lib/obs-plugins/linux-pipewire.so
#2  0x00007ffff1ee4853 in g_task_return_now () at /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgio-2.0.so.0
#3  0x00007ffff1ee4ac3 in g_task_return () at /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgio-2.0.so.0

#8  0x00007ffff1ee4853 in g_task_return_now () at /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgio-2.0.so.0

#11 0x00007ffff1b77028 in g_main_context_iterate.constprop () at /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0
#12 0x00007ffff1b1e4a3 in g_main_context_iteration () at /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0

    at /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt6Core.so.6

#16 0x000055555560fa57 in main ()
```

Seems to only occur if you open the Share window twice, such as by clicking the button "Select Window" in Properties twice, or by having a source already in your scene on startup, and then opening Properties -> "Select Window" -> Share a second time.

> Seems to only occur if you open the Share window twice, such as by clicking the button in Properties twice, or by having a source already in your scene on startup, and then opening Properties -> Share a second time.

it happens for me in all cases (not related to opening it twice). you can see from my log that I added it for the first time, then selected the display from the popup and clicked share. all without every closing that popup or clicking it again.

issue.title: linux-pipewire: Ensure n_drm_formats is zero initialized

labels.name: Bug Fix
labels.description: Non-breaking change which fixes an issue

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail. -->
<!--- If this change includes UI elements, please include screenshots. -->

We use a size_t that can be 64bit while EGL uses 32bit for the
underlying value on some platforms. Writes from our graphics function
can leave high bits uninitialized and cause iteration of the format list
to overlfow in those cases.

### Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open GitHub Issue, or implements feature request -->
<!--- from the Ideas page, please link to the issue here. -->
fixes #9844

This short write seems uncommon,  maybe this is just due to legacy nvidia drivers on the device in issue.

### How Has This Been Tested?
<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment (hardware, OS version, etc.),-->
<!--- and the tests you ran, including how it may affect other areas of code. -->
OBS still works on my machine.

### Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your PR introduce? Uncomment all that apply -->
- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
<!--- - New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) -->
<!--- - Tweak (non-breaking change to improve existing functionality) -->
<!--- - Performance enhancement (non-breaking change which improves efficiency) -->
<!--- - Code cleanup (non-breaking change which makes code smaller or more readable) -->
<!--- - Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change) -->
<!--- - Documentation (a change to documentation pages) -->

### Checklist:
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] My code has been run through [clang-format](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/.clang-format).
- [x] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [x] My code is not on the master branch.
- [x] The code has been tested.
- [x] All commit messages are properly formatted and commits squashed where appropriate.
- [x] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.

body:
Well, segfault is gone, but now it returns a black screen, when trying  to capture the screen or any window

![Screenshot from 2023-11-13 22-18-26](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/assets/17502269/9b00946e-d7e6-4adb-9912-6d066f2805d7)

We do not use GitHub Issues for support questions, since you are not having a crash, instead:

Please use the [Discord server](https://obsproject.com/discord) or the [forums](https://obsproject.com/forum). For more info, check our [Help page](https://obsproject.com/help).

issue.title: Segmentation fault on `pipewire.c:492` (drm_formats)

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Operating System Info

Other

### Other OS

Fedora 39

### OBS Studio Version

30.0.0

### OBS Studio Version (Other)

_No response_

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/PygioQRR0h5etE9B

### OBS Studio Crash Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/PygioQRR0h5etE9B

### Expected Behavior

No crash

### Current Behavior

Crash, sometimes.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Make a scene with pipewire window capture
2. Restart OBS
3. Observe a crash, too often.
...


### Anything else we should know?

Crashed with flatpak version. I then installed OBS via dnf, ran into a similar crash, and then ran under gdb to get the backtrace.
Intel integrated graphics.
